alert.note: Alert for Guilford (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 27 at 7:28AM EDT until May 27 at 7:45AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM EDT FOR WESTERN GUILFORD COUNTY... At 728 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Ruffin to 6 miles south of Monroeton to near Greensboro, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Greensboro, High Point, Summerfield, Stokesdale, Jamestown, Haw River State Park, Lake Townsend, Lake Jeanette Marina, Lake Brandt and Colfax. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM EDT for central North Carolina. Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly.
